title: Comparison in Turkish -dan/-den/-tan/-ten daha
desc: Learn about how to compare two things in Turkish using the suffix -DAn daha and adjectives.

body.raw: ## -DAn daha + sifat karsilastirma (than in Turkish) --- When comparing two things the structure `X is comparative adj. + than Y` in Turkish has a pattern `X Y-DAn daha + adj.`. üóíÔ∏è Note - In Turkish, the comparator comes after the things being compared as it is suffix based. Example would be "Summer is **better than** Winter(Yaz kƒ±≈ü**tan daha iyidir**)." Let us now break the suffix **-DAn daha** where - **D** ‚Üí d or t - **A** ‚Üí a or e | Last Vowel | Last Letter | than | | --- | --- | --- | | a-ƒ±-o-u | one of [ f, s, t, k, √ß, ≈ü, h, p ] | -**tan daha** | | a-ƒ±-o-u | one of [ other letters ] | -**dan daha** | | e-i-√∂-√º | one of [ f, s, t, k, √ß, ≈ü, h, p ] | -**ten daha** | | e-i-√∂-√º | one of [ other letters ] | -**den daha** | Examples Istanbul New York‚Äô**tan daha** kalabalƒ±k Asya Amerkika‚Äô**dan daha** b√ºy√ºk Limon portakal**dan daha** ek≈üi Antalya Isparta‚Äô**dan daha** sƒ±cak Bisiklet s√ºrmek y√ºr√ºmek**ten daha** hƒ±zlƒ± U√ßak tren**den daha** hƒ±zlƒ± --- Thanks for reading!
